issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.summary: APIs and CLIs for all infrastructure admin functionalities

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

fields.description: For the purposes of supporting client tool creation we need precise and accurate documentation about what the system APIs include.
fields.summary: Generate documentation for the service APIs

comments.body: Please see the aforementioned [pull request|https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/pull/16] for dev/grze/EUCA-4283.
[~gholms] Could you see the attachment and give guidance on the generated WSDLs usefulness?

This is quite helpful.  Thanks!

Recursion might be nice.  Or am I simply overlooking the definitions for things like {{ComponentInfoTypeItemType}}?

[~gholms]  I just pushed a version which works for the admin services to dev/grze/EUCA-4283.2 -- that fixes the recursion issue.  I'll wait for a bit but wish to get this back to testing for others to use.
[~gholms], this is awaiting your review, just making sure its still on your radar

Either I'm mis-reading something or some part of the recursion is broken.  When I ran the groovy script on some recent code I still didn't find a definition for {{ComponentInfoTypeItemType}}.

The only other major complaint I have at this point that I forgot to mention last time is that operations are named after their message types, but they should instead be named after the actions they perform.  The {{DescribeWalrusesType}} operation should be {{DescribeWalruses}}, for instance.

Minor nitpick:  xs:sequences and message parts are mis-indented.  If you can't control that don't worry about it; it isn't a huge problem.

Thanks for working on this, [~decker].
Hey [~decker], have you done any more work to these since the ones you sent to me a couple of weeks ago?
[~smarvin], although not in this ticket, the putback went back last week to make the changes requested.  I think we just need to regenerate the docs.

Thanks [~tjcramer]. So, [~decker], it looks like I'll need the updated WSDLs. Are they somewhere around where I can grab them?

Also, will these be versioned the same as each Eucalyptus version? Or will there be differences between them? We need to create our path structure on the website and I don't want that structure to be obsolete at 3.4.

Thanks.
[~smarvin], there's a doc ticket created for this already correct?  I also understand you have the latest WSDL's?

[~tjcramer], yep: DOC-636.

I don't know yet if I have the latest WSDLs. I'm still waiting confirmation from [~decker]. 

Besides having the latest, we need to discuss how these are versioned so that [~khadges] and I can determine a path to place each schema directory in. Right now, [~neil] and I are shooting for publishing schema docs after 3.3.1 GA.

Scot, moving this to in review for really post-3.3.1.  Chris is getting you the WSDL's under separate cover and the doc ticket will be the final result of this work.  I think the code changes are complete at this point
Hey [~tjcramer], can we close this out? I'm finishing the work under DOC-636.
